abstract.text: A programmatic interface for interacting with and observing calls.

inlineContent.text: object interacts with calls by performing actions, which are represented by instances of
subclasses. You can request that one or more actions be performed in a single
method. A transaction may be rejected by the system for one of the reasons listed in the
object, which can be accessed using the
property. You can provide an object conforming to the
protocol to the call observer in order to be notified of any changes to active calls.

abstract.text: Display the system-calling UI for your appâ€™s VoIP services, and coordinate your calling services with other apps and the system.
A programmatic interface for objects that represent a telephony action associated with a call object.
A programmatic interface for interacting with and observing calls.
Returns an observer for active calls.
Initializes a new call controller with a private, serial queue, which is used for calling completion blocks.
Initializes a new call controller with a specified queue, which is used for calling completion blocks.
Requests that the actions in the specified transaction be asynchronously performed by the telephony provider.
Requests that the transaction that contains the specified actions be asynchronously performed by the telephony provider.
Requests that the transaction that contains the specified action be asynchronously performed by the telephony provider.
A programmatic interface for an object that manages a list of active calls and observes call changes.
A collection of methods the system calls when a call changes state.
Error codes for the CallKit error domain.
Domain for errors when requesting a transaction from a call controller.
An encapsulation of the act of initiating an outgoing call.
An object that contains zero or more action objects for a call controller to perform.
Initiate outgoing calls with VoIP and configure your app to receive incoming calls.
Initiate VoIP calls when your server canâ€™t determine whether an outgoing notification is a request for a VoIP call due to metadata encryption.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
